p.c: Okay, we're good now, let's be the chapter character.
p.b:
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed394.png[/img]

Great. It seems that our next Player is finally ready to be exposed.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed395.png[/img]

A colorfully-garbed troll stands in a secret grotto deep within Alternia. After an excrutiating process rivaled only by the gauntlet some peculiar grubbyfur has completed concurrently, she has at last discovered the Grymoyre Rubrum!

What shall the moniker of this beauteous lady be?

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed396.png[/img]

You don't need to be called. After all, you are an eternal and supernatural essence enclosed within an snowy-skinned jewel, a perfect statue increasing the elegance and consequence of the world by your very existence. You have honored this land with your presence for many centuries. Your name is older than Alternia as people know it. Or you could be nine sweeps old and therefore appellated for some time. But such apparitions of youth and callowness shall not taint a single page of your flawless and most eloquent story.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed397.png[/img]

You are BATORI LOGARO.

Your neverending existence is enlightened by an infinity of INTERESTS, so we will only concentrate on the most common - and understandable by mortal spirits - of them. You rightfully claim to know everything of ALTERNIA'S HISTORY. Similarly, there is no ART which retains secrets from your extremely refined mind. You are particularly passionate about PAINTING, SCULPTURE and ARCHITECTURE. You enjoy SINISTER-LOOKING ACCESSORIES, and so you bought some JEWELS SCULPTED IN VERITABLE TROLL HORN from the renowned artist known as "The Artisan". LITERATURE mainly interests you because of stylish masterpieces such as [url=./assets/img/special/trollight.png]"WHERE THE HEART OF A YOUNG WOMAN IS RIPPED BETWEEN HER LOVE FOR FOUR RIVALS, THE FIRST ONE BEING A RAINBOW DRINKER, THE SECOND ONE BEING A WEREMUSCLEBEAST, THE THIRD ONE BEING A LEGISLACERATION DRONE, THE FOURTH ONE BEING A SHAMBLING UNDEAD, A FIFTH RIVAL EXISTS THAT IS A MYSTERY ; THE RAINBOW DRINKER IS LOVINGLY ABUSIVE, THE WEREMUSCLEBEAST AN ADORABLE RAPIST, THE DRONE CULLS CHILDREN AND THE SHAMBLING UNDEAD EATS BRAINS, ONE WOULD NEVER PENETRATE THE GIMMICK OF THE MYSTERIOUS FIFTH ONE"[/url] or the always inspiring [url=./assets/img/special/trollhushhush.png]"IN WHICH A YOUNG GIRL IS RELENTLESSLY SEXUALLY HARASSED, HUMILIATED, AND MIND-RAPED BY A DARK, MYSTERIOUS, AND SEXY BAD-BOY FEATHER-WINGED DWELLER OF THE ABOVE, AND DENIED THE FREEDOM TO ESCAPE FROM HIM EVENTUALLY FALLS INTO HIS POSSESSIVE BUT PROTECTIVE AND LOVING MUSCULAR ARMS, ORIGINAL STORY THAT IS IN NO WAY INSPIRED BY WTHOAYWIRBHLFFR TFOBARDTSOBAWTT OBALDTFOBASUAFRE TIAMTRDILATWAART DCCATSUEBOW NPTGOFMFO"[/url].

You are blessed by a rare and supernatural disease, a frightening and marvelous curse, which during ancient times turned your SKIN WHITE AND GLOWING, gifted you with even longer canine teeth than usual trolls, and empowered you with IMPOSSIBLE STRENGTH. You are no mere player of roles nor actress! You truly are a RAYNBOW DRYNKER, and your HEDONIST PHILOSOPHY allows you to fully enjoy your EXTRAORDINARY LIFETIME.

Your daily non-life is split between ONE-DAY-STANDS and the MYSTICAL QUESTS which allow you to enrich your ARCANYC SPELL COLLECTION and your YNSCRUTABLE STATS SHEET. You are of course a POWERFUL PSIONIC, with various magyckal aptitudes related to blood colour, but WYTCHCRAFT is a fey and labyrinthine matter, a secret of the ANCYENT ORDER OF RAYNBOW DRYNKERS.

You are now ready to divine new MYSTYCAL SPELLS in the pages of the Obscure Compendium that is the GRYMOYRE RUBRUM. Your trolltag is [color=#868A08]psychedeliciousRefreshments[/color] and [color=#868A08]you speak yn an arcane and rather omynous v-vay v-vorthy of your extraordynary transformatyon.[/color]

p.c: Batori: Remark on why a rainbow drinker such as yourself has such dull and ordinary skin.
p.b:
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed398.png[/img]

God's teeth! You made for your mystic destination so eagerly that you neglected to apply the esoteric potions which allow your physical form to reveal its true nature!

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed399.png[/img]

Lest anyone catch you so profanely bare, you enter MAKEUP MODE.

So enshrouded, you grasp the Grymoyre Rubrum and take it to your bosom.

You suppose the time has come for you to venture back through the caverns to your palatial home. Shall you stick to the well-worn path from whence you came, the Crimson Tunnels, surely the more perilous passageway now that the Drones must certainly have detected your powerful magycks? Or will you sally forth by the more unknown route, and ascend amongst the lofty erections of the Obsidian Spyres?

p.c: [S] Vamuin: Surely you must be adventurin' by now.
p.b: [img]./assets/img/story/doomed400.png[/img] [color=#a10000][ Pages with a soundtrack launch the music automatically. If the sound does not work on your browser, consider reloading the page with F5 or the Refresh button, or going through one or two more pages clicking on the next commands.] [/color] [ [i]Theme: Vangelis - Conquest of Paradise (Remix Hiphop)[/i] ] This game is so epic. Now you are in the shit, baby, and it's ass to kick time! No, wait, this shit is so epic, you are in the game, baby, time to kick some ass! Yeah! That's better. You got kinda distracted by all this shiny stuff. You aren't completely in your element. There is something strange here, something clearly uncool. And it's hella surreal with all the awesomeness in the surroundings. Your landing point leads you to a large roadway. It is connected to two thinner paths, in the same reflective orange marble. The first one is linked to two sets of stairs which disappear under a bridge. The second one leads to a building with your face all over it. Promising. And the main road itself ends on a large balcony where a lot of these red birds are talking.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed401.png[/img]

You can't help yourself, you need to contemplate once more DRED-GANI, your mighty PIXELEMENTAL. The "Nucleus" part got away, presumably to empower all of the bestiary with a tiny fraction of its awesomness, but you don't mind, you have the real deal.

And you are more than happy with it, since when the Nuclear Pixelemental turned into a simple Pixelemental, it turned from some kind of double ball with antennas, porn magazine, shirtless torsos and a killing whale corpse graviting around it to this luminescent beauty.

The only downside is, like, Dred and Gani are two distinct personalities, and they get stranger and stranger as time flows. You mean, come on, the magazine didn't even contain any nurse or plumber!

p.c: [S] Vamuin: Go for the building with your face all over it, it's sure to be hella sweet.
p.b: [img]./assets/img/story/doomed402.png[/img]
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed403.png[/img]
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed404.png[/img]

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed405.png[/img]

It's the most beautiful thing you've ever seen.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed406.png[/img]

You scribble the exact location of your Questcoon on your gigantic Land map. You need to level up before using this thing, but you sure will grind your way to it like a thousand skateboarders with antimatter reactors.

As soon as you find some enemies. Where the hell are these things? Are they afraid of you or something?

Meanwhile, Dred-Gani is banging itself. Whatever.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed407.png[/img]

A tempting proposition.

p.c: Batori: Abscond mysteriously by the shadow of the ebon spyres.
p.b:
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed408.png[/img]

Rhythm is essential when attending to such intimidating obelisks. One must be careful to take one's time, minister to them intensively, and in time, one will arrive at a higher plane.

To the left, mushrooms cast a gentle glow, much like your own shining visage. To the right, an intricate framework supports the rocky canopy.

p.c: Vamuin: Those red birds seem pretty interesting. Check'em out!
p.b:
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed409a.png[/img]

[spoiler open="Open NPC log" close="Close NPC log"][left]"These lines in the atmosphere were supposed to be a musical shield protecting us from the [u]Saturnine Sovereignty[/u]. But it was never finished, for [u]The Kapellmeister[/u] left us before its completion! Now barbaric [u]Subaltern Conscripts[/u] are wandering everywhere!"[/left][/spoiler][img]./assets/img/story/doomed409b.png[/img]

[spoiler open="Open NPC log" close="Close NPC log"][left]"Like all [u]Concomitants[/u], we are short-lived creatures. But since we have access to a huge vocabulary, and language defining every concept, we are way smarter than we would be otherwise. Philosophically, we have difficulties conceiving it as a blessing: do you have any idea how frustrating it is to be an intellectual species without opposable thumbs? "[/left][/spoiler][img]./assets/img/story/doomed409c.png[/img]

[spoiler open="Open NPC log" close="Close NPC log"][left]"To be fair, I think the gestalt concept is flawed at the core. An entire view of the whole situation could never be exhaustive. It is a natural error of any reflective being to forget their own fallibility. Details are extremely important and we should take our own lack of information into account."[/left][/spoiler][img]./assets/img/story/doomed409d.png[/img]

[spoiler open="Open NPC log" close="Close NPC log"][left]"This guy you just talked to was right, but not about the right thing. He just proved his own fallibility by overestimating the importance of the flaws in the original approach. Gestalt is a reality, if only for its interesting psychological applications, especially noticeable in ASCII art."[/left][/spoiler][img]./assets/img/story/doomed409e.png[/img]

[spoiler open="Open NPC log" close="Close NPC log"][left]"The previous guys are all idiots. Wisdom also lies within brevity."[/left][/spoiler][img]./assets/img/story/doomed409f.png[/img]

[spoiler open="Open NPC log" close="Close NPC log"][left]"I can be more concise than the previous one."[/left][/spoiler][img]./assets/img/story/doomed409g.png[/img]

[spoiler open="Open NPC log" close="Close NPC log"][left]"Me too."[/left][/spoiler][img]./assets/img/story/doomed409h.png[/img]

[spoiler open="Open NPC log" close="Close NPC log"][left]"Dude! O°o°o°h dude! What abo°ut flying right to° the 7th Heaven to°gether? If yo°u kno°w what I mean."[/left][/spoiler][img]./assets/img/story/doomed409i.png[/img]

[spoiler open="Open NPC log" close="Close NPC log"][left]"[u]The Swarming One[/u] did abominable things to our people. He was linked to the [u]Saturnine Sovereignty[/u] and not only did he commission legions of [u]Subaltern Conscripts[/u], he also created obscene, flying [u]Lieutenants[/u] by the most forbidden and unspeakable means. We rebelled against him and it lead to a great war during ancient times.
The demonic entity was defeated during the final battle. We sealed him and all of his miry spawn into [u]Horologiom[/u]. Only the bravest of heroes will be able to reunite the six [u]Hands of Destiny[/u] on the [u]Ominous Dial[/u] in order to open the doors to the organ palace and to destroy these hellish offspring once and for all."[/left][/spoiler][img]./assets/img/story/doomed409j.png[/img]

[spoiler open="Open NPC log" close="Close NPC log"][left]"Wow, did you talk to the previous [u]Archaeopteryx[/u] before me? Sucks to be you. The beginning of the story is actually next."[/left][/spoiler][img]./assets/img/story/doomed409r.png[/img]

[spoiler open="Open NPC log" close="Close NPC log"][left]"Once upon a time, [u]The Kapellmeister[/u] peacefully reigned in the [u]Territory of Metronomes and Marquetry[/u]. He was strong, just and extremely generous. He would have sacrificed himself for his [u]Concomitants[/u]. But the [u]Symphony of Atmosphere[/u] was a very hard work, and he got tired. While he was resting inside his huge organ palace, he was approached by a tiny creature. Our good leader should have been more cautious, because the [u]Calamari[/u] was the most vicious and maleficent entity. It said it was a seeker of power, and that if it was inserted instead [u]The Kapellmeister[/u]'s body, it could bless our monarch with tireless strength. The price to pay was simple: [u]The Kappelmeister[/u] would look exactly like the [u]Calamari[/u].
Our leader fell in the trap. He opened his mouth and the [u]Calamari[/u] slipped inside his body. [u]The Kapellmeister[/u] began to grow, to grow, to grow! Soon he was a giant, and he had paws just like the [u]Calamari[/u]'s, incredibly huge and powerful tentacles. The [u]Calamari[/u] grew too, but now, it was inextricably linked to its host. So this monster would never be released into the world. [u]The Kappelmeister[/u] was satisfied and soon returned to his work on the symphonic shield.
The trick was simple. While the strength of the body was bottomless, the spirit of [u]The Kappelmeister[/u] wasn't. He needed sleep, and he wasn't getting any. His energetic body never allowed him to sleep. He began to moan and to scream, but the [u]Calamari[/u] said the pact could not be abrogated.
With time, [u]The Kappelmeister[/u]'s soul became weak, partially amnesiac and irritated. He was now more malleable than modelling clay. The [u]Calamari[/u] assumed leadership. They became one, a terrible tyrant known as [u]The Swarming One[/u]."[/left][/spoiler][img]./assets/img/story/doomed409q.png[/img]

[spoiler open="Open NPC log" close="Close NPC log"][left]"When will the [u]Symphony of Atmosphere[/u] be achieved? Will the [u]Rhapsodist[/u] ever come and save us all?"[/left][/spoiler][img]./assets/img/story/doomed409l.png[/img]

[spoiler open="Open NPC log" close="Close NPC log"][left]"The [u]Rhapsodist[/u] must play the [u]Guitarbalète[/u]! It's the only way to ever complete the [u]Revolution of Perpetuation[/u]!"[/left][/spoiler][img]./assets/img/story/doomed409n.png[/img]

[spoiler open="Open NPC log" close="Close NPC log"][left]"My cousin lives in the next district of the [u]Wooden Continent[/u]. He possesses many [u]Fractured Confrontation Leitmotifs[/u], but he will only give them against loads and loads of [u]Mannawasalwa Shekels[/u], even if you are the [u]Rhapsodist[/u]!"[/left][/spoiler][img]./assets/img/story/doomed409m.png[/img]


[spoiler open="Open Pixelemental log" close="Close Pixelemental log"][left][color=#736AFF]DREDPIXELEMENTAL: Oh, suuuure, Mister Vamuin wanted the 'Lowest blood' Language Level. I hope Mister Vamuin feels happy about it right now.[/color]
[color=#B041FF]GANIPIXELEMENTAL: Dred, you bad boy! Don't talk badly about [i]Master[/i] Vamuin! [/color]
[color=#736AFF]DREDPIXELEMENTAL: I'm just saying this fucking terminology is getting...[/color]
[color=#B041FF]GANIPIXELEMENTAL: Do you want to be spanked?[/left][/color][/spoiler][img]./assets/img/story/doomed409o.png[/img]

[spoiler open="Open NPC log" close="Close NPC log"][left]"The [u]Subaltern Conscripts[/u] are becoming playful these days. A little [i]too[/i] playful."[/left][/spoiler][img]./assets/img/story/doomed409p.png[/img]

p.c: Batori: Check out the intricate framework that supports the rocky canopy.
p.b:
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed410.png[/img]

It appears stable. You will be able to penetrate deeper into the darkness if you wish.

Will you choose this path? Or will you opt to let the mushrooms guide you?

p.c: Vamuin: Ask your Concomitants where to find the Subaltern Conscripts!
p.b: [img]./assets/img/story/doomed411.png[/img][spoiler open="Open NPC log" close="Close NPC log"][left]"[u]The Subaltern Conscripts[/u] are getting more discreet. Many of us think it's because they witnessed the arrival of the [u]Rhapsodist[/u]. If you want my opinion, this is all religious bullshit. But I heard about a gathering in the North, near the [u]Cedar Stadium[/u]."[/left][/spoiler]

p.c: Vamuin: Find the Guitarbalète since it sounds important and it probably needed in order to win the game.
p.b:
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed412.png[/img]

Yep, that is a quest you can fulfill easily. At least with some smartness.

You jump on Dred-Gani and head back to the gigantic Guitar you saw earlier.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed413.png[/img]

Someone is contacting you on your freshly alchemized CAP-COMPUTER using an audio log. Who the hell uses sound-only devices these days?

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed414.png[/img]


[b]Audiolog[/b]
<audio src="./assets/img/special/radioginneo.mp3" autoplay controls></audio>

You try to answer, but apparently Ginneo isn't listening or something, because you only hear white noise and metallic sounds and scream-like screeching. What the fuck is the little fucker doing? Being your own Server Player is dumb, you will need him soon in order to optimize the killing/building ratio!

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed415.png[/img]

Anyway.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed416.png[/img]

Deep inside the colossal machine, you would normally need to resolve the Enigma of the Thirty-Three Harpabacii to activate the Guitarbalète.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed417.png[/img]

Incredibly boring since the Thirty-Three Harpabacii are installed for [i]miles[/i] around another location, Horologiom.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed418.png[/img]

Plus each of the many beads on each string is in reality some kind of sphere-shaped elevator you move higher or lower by resolving [i]another[/i] complicated puzzle within it.

Basically, to complete this quest, one needs to:

[left]- Collect the 333 "Little Hand" items with various subquests, each being the key to enter a bead,
- Make the 999 "Cryptocleps" items which will serve to complete the puzzles inside the beads (the cards for them are hella difficult to find and they cost a lot of rare Amaranthus Sawdust).
- Move the beads at the exact right place according to a boring series of equations you also need to find all around the Land,
- Enter the result of each equation at the end of the dungeon at the fundation of the Harpabacus (so 33 identical dungeons to "explore"), to obtain one unrelated code for each equation,
- Give all 33 codes to a special Concomitant who of course doesn't have a special appearance to obtain the Fugue of Sorrow.[/left]

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed419.png[/img]

But why bother when another person can do the job?

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed420.png[/img]

Especially when the other person is this awesome.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed421.png[/img]

You enter the Fugue inside the machinery.

Awakened by the music, the Consecrated Industrial Urvogels start to run the machine.
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed422.png[/img]
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed423.png[/img]
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed424.png[/img]
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed425.png[/img]

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed426.png[/img]

Now the wood stuff is stuck in another thing. Sweet! Your part of the Revolution of Perpetuation quest is complete!

You tell to the other Vamuin he can stay, but he answers he's late for the Thousand Vamuins Orgy.

p.c: Batori: Use this path. You shall shyne radyantly from the shadows, unlike you would with the mushrooms.
p.b:
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed427.png[/img]

Something seems to be amiss here...
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed428.png[/img]

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed429.png[/img]

Sweet god, it was a wriggler.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed430.png[/img]

And where wrigglers are, Nurse Drones follow.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed431.png[/img]

The Nurse Drones don't serve to care for the young ones, in actuality. They simply supervise their progress, from the moment they hatch to the day they form their first cocoon, from that cocoon to the deadly trials they must face to prove their worth, from those trials to the appraising eyes of potential guardians, from their lusii to the supervision of Carpenter Droids.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed432.png[/img]

They never intervene except for culling defective children, including those who try to reach the surface without first earning the privilege of life.

The model was never modified since the time immemorial when their purpose was caretaking, and so they euthanize unworthy larvae by way of an anaesthetic overdose.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed433.png[/img]

Intruders meet their end in this way.

Adult trolls find nothing but oblivion in these tunnels.

p.c: Vamuin: Um, the pornowhale is missing a head.
p.b:
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed434.png[/img]

Well, it was not the hardest investigation.

p.c: Batori: Be unorthodox. You're in a cave, aren't you? Use the surroundings to your advantage - any stalactites around?
p.b: [img]./assets/img/story/doomed437.png[/img]
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed438.png[/img]

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed439.png[/img]

Why use a stalactite when you can destroy scaffolding?

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed440.png[/img]

Beneath their abominable, latex-like skin, the Nurse Drones have neither flesh nor bone, but one of the strongest alloys known to trollkind. So you doubt it will serve to do anything more than slow the Drone down, and you already know this is not a standoff you are destined to win.

You observe a temporary and elegant retreat, obviously the most prudent course of action. In truth, possibly the best idea you have conceived of in your long, long life.

p.c: Vamuin: Try to figure out time powers - fast.
p.b:
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed441.png[/img]

[spoiler open="Open Pixelemental log" close="Close Pixelemental log"][left][color=#045FB4]VAMUIN: Rendezvo°us at Cedar Stadium.[/color]
[color=#B041FF]GANIPIXELEMENTAL: Master Vamuin? What are you doing?[/color]
[color=#045FB4]VAMUIN: Later babe later.[/color][/left][/spoiler]
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed442.png[/img]

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed443.png[/img]

You figure out your time powers without any effort and come back one hour before. You clearly need at least this extra time to pick the best Concomitant team you can.

Not detailed here: Some multiple-incarnations shenanigans which are of no special interest but involve a lot of clever use of the Thaumifice Substratum in order to produce a combat droid despite your current lack of Amaranthus Sawdust.

Sawdust can't be directly given to your main game by your Alternates, you would need to delete some of their loot, and you will [i]never[/i] delete loot, no matter how useless it is, except if it allows you to obtain Zitan wood.

You also complete a quick and stupid subquest to convince big-mustache Concomitant to join you.

And finally the team is complete.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed602.png[/img]

Assuredly, it was an exhausting journey. Your presence in the caves of the youth's trials did not go without notice, and you were accosted by hordes of agitated drones on your way home.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed603.png[/img]

But at long last, you managed to reach your incontentestibly imposing and certainly not one-dimensional, simulated or farcical castle.

The ominously fiery skies disquiet your mind somewhat, but Vamuin has assured you the session will save you from such a grim fate. Consequently, you are resolved to enter the game with most imperative haste.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed604.png[/img]

You now reside in your respiteblock, and are profoundly inquisitive (and somewhat concerned, if the truth be known) about how the situation evolved after your untimely egress. You pray the little grub's breast has not been stilled in cold sleep in the interim.

[i]Or whether doth my mind, being crowned with you,
Drink up the monarch's plague, this flattery?
Or whether shall I say mine eye saith true,
And that your love taught it this alchemy,
To make of monsters and things indigest
Such cherubins as your sweet self resemble,
Creating every bad a perfect best
As fast as objects to his beams assemble?
O 'tis the first; 'tis flattery in my seeing,
And my great mind most kingly drinks it up.
Mine eye well knows what with his gust is greeing,
And to his palate doth prepare the cup.
If it be poisoned, 'tis the lesser sin --
That mine eye loves it and doth first begin.[/i]

But it will never be warm enough. Plus it isn't easy to move around. As a little genius grub, you can do way better!

p.c: Ginneo: Combine Love Concession Suit and various dolls.
p.b:
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed690a.png[/img]

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed690b.png[/img]

You obtain the ELIASUIT!

Perfect!

p.c: Ginneo: Combine Computer and Black Chair.
p.b:
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed691a.png[/img]

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed691b.png[/img]

Magnificently heavy and voluminous.

p.c: Ginneo: Combine Black Sabbat Chaircomputer and Magical Unicorn Horn.
p.b:
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed692a.png[/img]

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed692b.png[/img]

The idea is good, but it's not cute enough.

p.c: Ginneo: Combine Computer and Ronhld Mk Dunald Poster.
p.b:
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed693a.png[/img]

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed693b.png[/img]

This new approach is promising, but you are back to an unpractical computer!

And this time, it's even edible. Your smartness tells you in a world this desolated, using an eatable communication device isn't the best idea. Your own Concomitants could be tempted!

p.c: Ginneo: Combine Ronhld Mk Dunald Poster and Therihorn.
p.b:
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed694a.png[/img]

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed694b.png[/img]

You obtain the DEVIN HORN!

You couldn't dream of better!

p.c: Ginneo: Combine Lil' Prosp and Eat-pay Niwayz Mannequin.
p.b:
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed695a.png[/img]

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed695b.png[/img]

While you're at it, you use the Thaumifice Substratum to offer your best friend a real family!

Lil' Prosp is smiling.

p.c: Ginneo: Combine Miraculous Clown && Sad Lollipop.
p.b:
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed696a.png[/img]

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed696b.png[/img]

Well, it looks nice but not very useful. You need a good doll to use your game power!

Maybe by double perforation instead of card-overlapping? Fanny's files said results were different!

p.c: Ginneo: Combine Miraculous Clown || Sad Lollipop.
p.b:
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed697a.png[/img]

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed697b.png[/img]

You create DANDELO!

Yay! Finally, the artifact you needed. And you can suck it whenever you want to!

p.c: Ginneo: Combine Black Chair || Broken Nursedrone.
p.b:
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed698a.png[/img]

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed698b.png[/img]

... Just the furniture you were desperately craving to obtain. An uncomfortable chair which can put you to sleep for really too long.

Moving on!

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed699a.png[/img]

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed699b.png[/img]

You make the ENIGMAW.

You are using a lot of Fanny's RLYEHSTONE, and your creations start to look less cute. Maybe you should slow down.

But you also wonder what would happen if you return to the overlapping to mix the chair and the drone in a different way! Maybe you can have a drone with a saddle or a chair on its head or something.

p.c: Ginneo: Combine Black Chair && Broken Nursedrone.
p.b:
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed700a.png[/img]

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed700b.png[/img]

Oh... maybe... maybe it's time to stop fooling around!

How do you even obtain this result with a chair? It was just a chair! A cute, innocent chair!

p.c: Ginneo: Combine Little Rattle and Sopor slime.
p.b:
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed701a.png[/img]

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed701b.png[/img]

You obtain the pacifying weapon SMELL NOT THE WATCHERS!

p.c: Ginneo: Pour the sopor from the cradle unto the abomination!
p.b:
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed702.png[/img]

You can always try! Even if you plan to get away by other means.

You just wish you could use another container. You feel like you're starring in some really really nasty movie!

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed703.png[/img]

A little too high. Oh, someone is contacting you.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed704.png[/img]

Why, a balcony should prove itself more valuable to get around the tumultuous pixelemental.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed705.png[/img]

You cannot be Ophiuchus the Great because Ophiuchus the Great is busy preparing his departure! 

After escaping a certain death at the hands of his past employees, and another, even closer one coming from his various guests - who succeeded in their escape - he is now running away from the cops.

Talk about a rotten day.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed706.png[/img]

You can be Ophiuchus' lusus, but you cannot move.

You can only watch the deranged troll packing, knowing he will never free you. Knowing you will never be able to detach yourself from the wall and you will very probably die a slow, painful death by starvation.

But you do not panic. You're beyond the point where you would mind it. Any kind of ultimate liberation will be welcome now.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed707.png[/img]

p.c: Vamuin: Calmly walk to something that looks like it will be satisfying to destroy.
p.b:
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed714.png[/img]

Walk?

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed715.png[/img]

Walk?

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed716.png[/img]

WALK?

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed717.png[/img]

YOU'LL GIVE THEM WALK!

p.c: Vamuin: Have a psychic meltdown of epic proportions.
p.b: [img]./assets/img/story/doomed718.png[/img]
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed719.png[/img]
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed720.png[/img]
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed721.png[/img]

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed722.png[/img]

You inadvertently reach the top of your Stratospectral Escalevelator.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed723.png[/img] [ [i]Theme: Scharvona - Ice of Life[/i] ] Well, your nonviolent playthrough is starting very nicely! Looks like you can obtain Sawdust even without finishing the enemies. But you can't continue your travel in such a big land without indications! Maybe you can ask to the cute pink dogs?

p.c: [S] Ginneo: Reach village of pink dogs.
p.b:
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed724a.png[/img]

[spoiler open="Open NPC log" close="Close NPC log"][left]"Welcome, kind stranger, to the [u]Territory of Belligerence and Glaciation[/u]. I am Immanuel Kant, citizen amongst other citizens of this little village. And judging by your looks and attitude, you must certainly be the [u]Heritor of Evisceration[/u]. We wrote songs about you. We do not have much food or goods, but we will help you as much as we can."[/left][/spoiler][img]./assets/img/story/doomed724b.png[/img]

[spoiler open="Open NPC log" close="Close NPC log"][left]"The [u]Construction Set[/u] was originally going to be a revolution: new, simpler, more comfortable homes for us. But [u]The Disfiguring One[/u] took control of it and sent all of our legitimate residences floating in the sky. Please help us in taking back our homes!"[/left][/spoiler][img]./assets/img/story/doomed724c.png[/img]

[spoiler open="Open NPC log" close="Close NPC log"][left]"Being covered in fur helps greatly in such cold times. Especially since here, winter lasts forever."[/left][/spoiler][img]./assets/img/story/doomed724d.png[/img]

[spoiler open="Open NPC log" close="Close NPC log"][left]"We [u]Thylacines[/u] are neither dogs nor tigers! We belong to the marsupial order. I hope you feel galvanized and illuminated by this deliciously fresh bit of knowledge."[/left][/spoiler][img]./assets/img/story/doomed724e.png[/img]

[spoiler open="Open NPC log" close="Close NPC log"][left]"Once upon a time, this land was warm. Okay, only joking, this land was already colder than a priest's rear end. But it was in peace. Then [u]Instruments[/u] of the [u]Saturnine Sovereignty[/u] started to talk with our leaders. Tensions grew, erupted into stupid quarrels, and soon enough, our snow fields as well as the [u]Crystalline Oceans[/u] were blazed by war."[/left][/spoiler][img]./assets/img/story/doomed724f.png[/img]

[spoiler open="Open NPC log" close="Close NPC log"][left]"The factions started launching more and more warships sliding on the ice. But so many battles exploded on the [u]Oceans[/u] they cracked and melted. In the smoke and the fury, most of the brutes forces were drowned. One of the greatest military leaders, [u]The Disfiguring One[/u], took this opportunity to capture very solid vehicles, the only ones left, the fleet no one ever thought about... The [u]Construction Set[/u]. They were intended to be well-heated, lasting and easily movable houses. They became his fleet."[/left][/spoiler][img]./assets/img/story/doomed724g.png[/img]

[spoiler open="Open NPC log" close="Close NPC log"][left]"But the [u]Apocryptid Resident[/u] was weakened. He dove in a long sleep, and locked the [u]Rubik's Mirror[/u], the thickest vessel in the improvised fleet, around him. If you want to challenge him, you need to duplicate the legendary artifact he keeps with him during his rest, the [u]Speculum Alchemiae[/u]. It is a scale model of the [u]Rubik's Mirror[/u] you can manipulate. If you manage to solve the puzzle, it will open the real mirror."[/left][/spoiler][img]./assets/img/story/doomed724h.png[/img]

[spoiler open="Open NPC log" close="Close NPC log"][left]"The [u]Thylacines[/u] all have a ventral pouch. Except... in bipedal position, it's upside-down. How very useful."[/left][/spoiler][img]./assets/img/story/doomed724i.png[/img]

[spoiler open="Open NPC log" close="Close NPC log"][left]"All of the ice-sliding fleet is still there, frozen in the ice of the [u]Crystalline Oceans[/u]. What warrior will be brave enough to explore the fissures? To reach and to reactivate the [u]88 Master Battleships[/u]? Hell, it's an unavoidable step to accomplish the [u]Revolution of Perpetuation[/u]!"[/left][/spoiler][img]./assets/img/story/doomed724j.png[/img]

[spoiler open="Open NPC log" close="Close NPC log"][left]"Our people share many old and sad songs about the [u]Heroes[/u]. But today, most of them are forgotten. Oh, you are interested? Let's see, I remember part of this one... Something about unexpected help, from a being from ancient times, then...
'[i]The prisms should shine,
The horns in line,
Mud snakes unleashed,
Darkness entombed,
The sand will flow.
And the flesh must grow.[/i]'
Wow, what a relief. It sure doesn't sound ominous at all."[/left][/spoiler][img]./assets/img/story/doomed724k.png[/img]

[spoiler open="Open NPC log" close="Close NPC log"][left]"The [u]Lighthouse[/u] is supposed to illuminate the [u]Crystalline Oceans[/u] and therefore would allow us to see any enemy coming. But it was deactivated during the war."[/left][/spoiler][img]./assets/img/story/doomed724l.png[/img]

[spoiler open="Open NPC log" close="Close NPC log"][left]"The armies of the [u]Resident[/u] are still there. Waiting. Shall [u]The Disfiguring One[/u] wake up, they will be there. They hate him and despise him, but they will be there."[/left][/spoiler][img]./assets/img/story/doomed724m.png[/img]

[spoiler open="Open NPC log" close="Close NPC log"][left]"The [u]Cerulean Peaks[/u] are full of mysteries for sure! A little puppy got lost in one of these summits yesterday. Hey, listen! If you are such a hero, why won't you go looking for him? I would give you something nice in exchange for the kid."[/left][/spoiler][img]./assets/img/story/doomed724n.png[/img]

p.c: [S] Ginneo: To the Cerulean Peaks, you need to find the lost puppy!
p.b:
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed725.png[/img][spoiler open="Open NPC log" close="Close NPC log"][left]"The puppy? I believe he went to the [u]Twin Peaks[/u] to the north of the village. You're gonna need better climbing equipment, Heritor!"[/left][/spoiler]

Why did he say that? You never had any equipment of this kind.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed726.png[/img]

You receive the CLIMBING EQUIPMENT!

[spoiler open="GINNEO'S SYLLADEX" close="Close sylladex"][left][b]- ONE "LOVE CONCESSION"  SUIT[/b]
Named after the cutest comics on the entire Alternia Wide Web, this suit is just too cute to be left behind!

[b]- ONE CLOWNESQUE LOLLIPOP[/b]
One can wonder if this sweet is strawberry or meat flavored. Maybe a little taste from both worlds?

[b]- DANDELO[/b]
The clown marionette needed to work your "Pawppet Master" game power.

[b]- ENIGMAW[/b]
A mechanical sphinx coated in the usual rubber-like layer of most drones. It will inject you a deadly dose of anesthetics if you are not able to answer its riddle correctly.

[b]- YOUR CLIMBING EQUIPMENT[/b]
A huge box containing ice axes, crampons, grapnels, ice screws, and other accessories you do not recognize. It is a gift from Kant's village.[/left][/spoiler]
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed727.png[/img] [ [i]Theme: Scharvona - Be Wheely Careful[/i] ]

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed728.png[/img]

The climbing is hard, especially with a mutilated hand, but you are very brave!

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed729.png[/img]

The trial makes you wonder how a little puppy managed to get higher, however.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed730.png[/img]

Or how you can do it, since you are an even younger being! You are just a little grub. But at times like this, you can feel huge muscles working in your body. Body which feels too large to be really larval...
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed731.png[/img]

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed732.png[/img]

Your... head... hurts...

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed733.png[/img]

You return to the climbing. You can't be slowed down by your headaches now. You have a Concomitant kid to save!

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed734.png[/img]

You finally reach a tunnel leading to a cute giant dollhive.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed735.png[/img]

Something is wrong here.

p.c: Vamuin: Time to ask yourself about your matesprit.
p.b:
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed736.png[/img]

You feel really worried about Tozy. And also about your entire world. What is happening outside the session? Is that really the end of the world? Did you trigger it? Did the Sollux kid you stole the game from trigger it? Is it only happening to Alternia, or to the entire Empire?

You didn't read most of the background data, and you start feeling really stupid about it. You only cared about beating the most important game, becoming a god, creating a new world. With Perfect Play, Speedrun, mundane language and WITHOUT all of the options for pussies like hidden moon questcoons or dreambubbles, of course.
You are too awesome to play this game like a beginner.

But now...

Concomitants babbling about "doom" half the time. Alternate Vamuins also starting to talk about "doomed" or "destroyed" timelines. Matesprit disappeared, Via unreachable, Victory unrecoverable... And of course, Gin joining the team. What were you thinking.

p.c: Vamuin: Consider scratching this Session? Because things are starting to head south real fast.
p.b:
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed737.png[/img]

The Excoriation process is easy enough to start. You only need to damage the disc of the Victorola Gramophone.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed738.png[/img]

But you won't do it.

The SGRUBrip data indicates the Excoriation would reset your entire existence. You as you exist now will be erased. Forever.

Between nonexistence and immortality, the choice is quickly made. You will win this session. 

And if things get too ugly, you will just go back in time with your powers. You are too powerful to lose.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed739.png[/img]

Though an eternal life of Esoteric Magick and hedonistic pleasure is exquisitely enjoyable, it is also fraught with long times of lassitude and despair.

However, this wait in particular is especially tiresome. What has kept Vamuin? He told you he "just had to finish a last little quest" and then he would contact you.

You are still waiting.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed740.png[/img]

And the little grub is ever busy with another subquest. That's it. You shall erect the hive of your newfound moirail further, turning it into a majestic tower.

p.c: Ginneo: Be careful, there are traps in that hive!
p.b:
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed741.png[/img]

Oh no! The bestiary has inherited your lusus' craftiness and mischievousness. This will be a hard game!

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed742.png[/img]

Luckily, you manage to spot and to avoid the five traps. The sign indicated only four of them... Seems like the Pucks even got into the habit of adding some extra traps!

[spoiler open="Open NPC log" close="Close NPC log"][left]"You are not a Thylacine! Who are you? Are you one of the evil people?"
[color=#03B2CD]GINNEO: Do not be afraifraid! I am here to help you![/color]
"Yay! Are you the Hero of the prophecy?"
[color=#03B2CD]GINNEO: I don't gnow if I am a hero... I am just a little grub, you gnow. But let's try to get you out of here![/color]
"Not so fast nice person... Look out!"[/left][/spoiler]

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed813.gif[/img]
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed814.png[/img]

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed815.png[/img]

Even if you have now the face of a velociraptor, the trick is worth a try. Time to remember all the elaborate and antediluvian tongue techniques your ancestors perpetuated in homage to the prophecies.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed816.png[/img]

This doesn't work, despite your best efforts. 

You are not a Lunatic Primacy. Your kiss is worthless.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed817.png[/img]

However, by trying such extremely powerful cosmic action in such risky circumstances, you inadvertently trigger a rare bug.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed818.png[/img]

You manage to reach Dog Tier.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed819.png[/img]

Or rather the reverse.
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed820.png[/img]
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed821.png[/img]

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed822.png[/img]

You are unrendered limb from limb.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed823.png[/img]

The Undog Tier skins you of every doglike attribute before afflicting you with reverse omnipotence, making you utterly powerless.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed824.png[/img]

You don't even have the strength to move.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed825.png[/img]

Nor the mouth to scream.
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed826.png[/img]
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed827.png[/img]
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed828.png[/img]
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed829.png[/img]

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed830.png[/img]

Your head hurts so much.

You are clearly back to reality.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed831.png[/img]

Where are you? Have you been here before?

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed832.png[/img]

You don't remember this being here before...

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed833.png[/img]

It only leads to a thick ceiling. It doesn't sound hollow, and you can't break it with your weapon! You can't find any kind of slit or button, either.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed834.png[/img]

[spoiler open="GINNEO'S SYLLADEX" close="Close sylladex"][left][b]- ONE "LOVE CONCESSION" SUIT[/b]
AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA

[b]- ONE #£$% LOLLIPOP[/b]
We can want to know or this dance the strawberry or this meat [of aromatizontai] and the blood is. deCI perhaps small of flavor two of cortecce?

[b]- DANDELO[/b]
£$$$$###@" Pawppet Master" °)²%¤µµ

[b]- ENIGMAW[/b]
A mechanical sphinx coated in the usual rubber-like layer of most drones. It will inject you a deadly dose of anesthetics if you are not ableableableableable

[b]- YOUR GOLF EQUIPMENT[/b]
A huge box containing clubs, balls, golf pants, and other accessories you do not recognize. It is a gift from Emmanuel's village.[/left][/spoiler]

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed835.png[/img]

The only painting light enough for you to remove without being crushed by it reveals a... sheet of paper?

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed836.png[/img]

While searching for some tool, you can't help but think about what happened. If you woke up here, apparently not in your Dream Recuperacoon, it means you didn't die, right? So it was all a dream.

But if it was all a dream, where is the puppy?

p.c: Ginneo: Check under the couch cushions for anything.
p.b:
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed837.png[/img]

You find the RUSTY PINCER!

Wow, that's even more convenient than a health vial before a boss!

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed838.png[/img]

You can't take it, it's well-fixed inside the wall. You do manage to rip part of it, though.

But you can't captchalogue the piece of paper, too. The pincer filled the last remaining slot in your sylladex.

p.c: Ginneo: Look on the other side.
p.b: [img]./assets/img/story/doomed839.jpg[/img]
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed840.jpg[/img]
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed841.png[/img]
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed842.png[/img]

p.c: Ginneo: Put the painting back and never speak of this again.
p.b:
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed843.png[/img]

That's fine by you.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed844.png[/img]

You cut the barbed wire and reach the first floor.

No exit in sight.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed845.png[/img]

You notice two creepy creatures, behind a narrow curtain of barbed wire. One of them brings bad memories back, and the other seems to be a prisoner. It does look like some ugly monster, but you feel sad for them!

And also something yellow on the ground.

p.c: Ginneo: Use Dandelo to walk around the other side of the wire.
p.b:
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed846.png[/img]

You don't know much about your "Pawppet Master" power, but you know Dandelo is needed. Maybe you can put him through the barbed wire. And then your doll will take the yellow thing for you.

For now, you try to control it with all your resolve!

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed847.png[/img]

You concentrate hard.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed848.png[/img]

Nothing is happening...

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed849.png[/img]

Wait.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed850.png[/img]

Meanwhile, at Horologiom...

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed851.png[/img]

Wait, Cine Mode budget running out right now...

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed852.png[/img]

Meanwhile, at Horologiom rendered in a more symbolic manner...
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed853.png[/img]
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed854.png[/img]

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed855.png[/img]

[spoiler open="Open Ego log" close="Close Ego log"][left][color=#045FB4]ALTERNATE VAMUIN #122: O°kay, so° I guess it's time to° ro°ck?[/color][/left][/spoiler]

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed856.png[/img]

[spoiler open="Open Ego log" close="Close Ego log"][left][color=#045FB4]ALTERNATE VAMUIN #655: Wait, why isn't Alpha here?
ALTERNATE VAMUIN #655: I mean, it's like, everything is ready no°w, the sand is do°wn the ho°urglasses, we just have to° put the [u]Hands o°f Destiny[/u] on this clo°ckface and then all o°f this will go° BO°O°M!
ALTERNATE VAMUIN #655: And Alpha is what?
ALTERNATE VAMUIN #655: Alpha is fucking late.
ALTERNATE VAMUIN #655: He'd better have a go°o°d reaso°n fo°r missing the big scene... [/color][/left][/spoiler]

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed857.png[/img] 

[spoiler open="Open Ego log" close="Close Ego log"][left][color=#045FB4]ALTERNATE VAMUIN #122: Dude! He has to° bo°ne so°meo°ne o°bvio°usly.
ALTERNATE VAMUIN #655: O°h. O°kay then.[/color][/left][/spoiler]

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed858.png[/img]

Ouch, the precise resolution of this riddle sure was labored. But now you have managed to captchalogue the poor limbless creature, to cut all of the wires and to obtain the yellow card.
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed859.png[/img] [ Theme: MoNACA & Nishimura - Gods bound by rules ]

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed860.png[/img]

In the center of the painted door is an horizontal slot.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed861.png[/img]

You slide the card into the slot.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed862.png[/img]

It opens, allowing you to leave the place!

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed863.png[/img]

That's strange, you are sure you only saw one shape imprisoned in the Twin Peaks when you climbed the right one. 

Oh well. Time to get back to the village. You would take the creature with you, but it is really slow and complicated to manipulate every limb of Dandelo to repeat the move on the enemy. You won't do that in this blizzard.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed864.png[/img]

So you just make him run through the barbwire. Sorry, mister Augustine.

Even if you're trying to do a nonviolent playthrough, you draw the line at lichthings cosplaying as murderous lusii.

You feel pretty awful about it, but you're not an idiot. You're a little [i]genius[/i] grub.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed865.png[/img]

The explosives are placed, and everything is in readiness. Ere much longer, naught will impede your vision of architectural perfection.
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed866.png[/img]

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed867.png[/img]

The added weight of all the sand which constituted the Sundial islands lowers a giant platform, extracting the Chenille Stems of Foreordination from Horologiom's organ.
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed868.png[/img]
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed869.png[/img]
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed870.png[/img]
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed871.png[/img]
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed872.png[/img]
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed873.png[/img]
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed874.png[/img]
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed876.png[/img]
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed877.png[/img]

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed879.png[/img]


[img]./assets/img/story/doomed878.png[/img]

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed880.png[/img]


[img]./assets/img/story/doomed881.png[/img]

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed882.png[/img]

What was this resonance?

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed883.png[/img]

This was an act of war.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed884.png[/img]

Your suffering lasted for aeons. Your sleep was made from darkest ink and palest flesh. Forthwith, you are only tormented by the deep urge to share and multiply your pain.
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed885.png[/img]
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed886.png[/img]
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed887.png[/img]
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed888.png[/img]
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed889.png[/img]
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed890.png[/img]
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed891.png[/img]
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed892.png[/img]
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed893.png[/img]

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed894.png[/img]

You have not yet begun to build.

p.c: Ginneo: Bring the strange sad monster to the village.
p.b:
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed895.png[/img]

The villagers are thanking you for entrusting them with this poor, unrecognizable thing, and they'll do everything they can to make its life better. Maybe they can cut it a mouth first, if there are jaws behind this smooth skin.

You say you have some items which can help with anaesthesia.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed896.png[/img]
[spoiler open="Open NPC log" close="Close NPC log"][left]"But I'm anxious because of the tempest. With such chaos and electricity, I cannot see any of the vessels in the sky. I don't like this. "[/left][/spoiler]

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed897.png[/img]

Well, you could do something about it, you guess, but you also need to help Fanny, your best friend! You were supposed to be his Server Player but didn't do anything yet.

In the meantime, you could send some Concomitants to fulfil other objectives. The atmosphere these days is quite threatening, and you don't want the planet of your new friends to be ravaged!

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed898.png[/img]

After sending a solid team to the Lighthouse, you sit at the center of the village and begin what the villagers quickly conclude is some kind of mystical meditation.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed899.png[/img]

Fanny's hive looks like it has been damaged somehow. For a start, two walls are destroyed and the load gaper is on the roof.

You were right, he needs your help right now!

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed900.png[/img]

You start adding cuteness to the mix!
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed901.png[/img]

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed902.png[/img]

The villager who entrusted you with the Peaks subquest asks why you didn't bring his child back.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed903.png[/img]

You answer you're sorry. You had found the puppy, and he helped you overcoming some of the trials... then you both got lost.

But the little boy was reasonable, responsible and very helpful! You're sure he's okay.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed904.png[/img]

The father hopes you're right.
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed905.png[/img]

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed906.png[/img]

Before his concerns are suddenly erased all along with his life and consciousness.
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed907.png[/img] [ [i]Theme: Yamaoka - Ice[/i] ]

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed908.png[/img]

Everything is frozen inside of this building.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed909.png[/img]

But most of the Concomitants in the team belong to the sacred Tasmanian Order, and therefore know everything about this world's riddles. They quickly manage to make the machinery work correctly.
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed910.png[/img]
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed911.png[/img]
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed912.png[/img]

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed913.png[/img]

The powerful beam of light is brushing the night, the tempest and the ice. 

Any aerial or naval approach is now impossible. The Thylacines will be able to see the enemy coming. To defend themselves.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed914.png[/img]

But for one precise village, it's already too late.

p.c: Vamuin: Why haven't you god tiered yet?
p.b:
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed915.png[/img]

You have priorities.
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed916.png[/img]
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed917.png[/img]

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed918.png[/img]

The idea is hella simple. You're going to see if you can wake up an Egoneir by screwing their brains out.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed919.png[/img]

A consenting Egoneir, of course.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed920.png[/img]

Your Territory can wait for one hour or two, you guess.

p.c: Ginneo: It's time to kick ass and have flashbacks.
p.b:
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed921.png[/img]

It's the only way. You cannot stun them. They will shoot you if you come out.

You must use your Game Power, again, for the worst purposes.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed922.png[/img]

No. You can't do this. It was awful enough back in the Peaks.

You can't do this again.
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed923.png[/img]
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed924.png[/img]
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed925.png[/img]
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed926.png[/img]
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed927.png[/img]
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed928.png[/img]
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed929.png[/img]

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed930.png[/img]

You... do not feel so well.

As if something was missing.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed931.png[/img]

You can do this. It's horrible, but everyone is counting on you.

p.c: Toy Soldier: Live your last moments.
p.b:
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed933.png[/img]

The battle is almost won. You are guarding the center of the village.

You live your last moments in blissful ignorance of the fate about to punch you in the face.

p.c: Ginneo: Turn the soldiers against each other.
p.b: [img]./assets/img/story/doomed932.png[/img]

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed934.png[/img]

You remove the will from a soldier's body and replace it with your own.
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed935.png[/img]

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed936.png[/img]

"Socrates! What are you doing?"

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed937.png[/img]

"S-Stop it or I'll open fire!"

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed938.png[/img]

"I can't! I just can't!"
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed939.png[/img]

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed940.png[/img]

"Sergeant... You just saved my life. Socrates was going to...."

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed941.png[/img]

"S-Sergeant?"

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed942.png[/img]

"Help! Sergeant Wittgenstein has gone crazy!"
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed943.png[/img]

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed944.png[/img]

"Gosh! They killed Wittgenstein!"
"It's mutiny!"

p.c: Ginneo: Get the puppies to safety!
p.b:
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed945.png[/img]

Taking advantage of the sudden chaos, you load all the kids you can find on the fastest vehicle you have.

They aren't very reassured, but this will have to do.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed946.png[/img]

You're getting used to things turning for the worst.

So you tell the mechanical sphinx to NOT use its syringe to anaesthetize the kids!

And since you'd like to not [i]completely[/i] screw your nonviolent playthrough, you also instruct it to NOT overanaesthetize the soldiers. And to avoid all kinds of enemies as long as the puppies aren't in a safe place would probably be a good idea.

Maybe they will all surrender once you've defeated the Resident or something? You don't know.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed947.png[/img]

Go Enigmaw go!

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed948.png[/img]

"Stop it, soldiers! This is an order!"

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed949.png[/img]

"The Heritor is there. Somewhere. It is his handiwork. He is possessing you. One at a time."

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed950.png[/img]

"One, if you feel possessed, just start screaming. Two, if you're close to a screaming soldier, neutralize him without killing him. Three, if you're not, search everywhere for the Heritor."

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed951.png[/img]

"Heritor! We can find you. We [i]will[/i] find you."

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed952.png[/img]

"However, we wish to avoid more 'collateral damage'. In addition to this, the mission was always planned to be a bloodbath, a situation which doesn't particularly please us. Despite all appearances, we are not bloodthirsty monsters. We are merely following orders. So maybe we can reach an understanding here."

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed953.png[/img]

"Surrender now. Reveal yourself and we'll spare the lives of the surviving Concomitants!"

p.c: Ginneo: Stitch the puppet's mouth shut and continue taking over their bodies. Or possess each in turn and have each toy soldier tie one another up without killing or maiming until there are none left. You heard that, right? If you possess the soldiers, they'll disable themselves without you having to kill any of them! Take this opportunity to see how quickly you can jump between soldiers using your ability. Or take control of the commanding officer, and let him kill the soldier threatening concomitant next to him. Without him they are likely to lose their remaining discipline. Or send the soldiers to...
p.b:
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed954.png[/img]

A lot of possible plans are going through your head, but you can't think of any which doesn't end up with the death of one or two hostages.

But maybe if you had external help...

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed955.png[/img]

A long, happy nap.

"We must bring him and his possessions to Truncare quickly. A Lunatic Primacy can be resurrected by the kiss of another Chosen One."
"Are you kidding, captain?"
"I wish I was."

"And the village? They will try to avenge him."
"The Heritor has our word. And he paid for it with his life. Leave them alone."

p.c: Egoneir Ginneo: What can you see from here?

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed987.png[/img]

This sinister room constitutes the summit of a tower, apparently.

In your immediate surroundings, you can behold two other towers following the curve of the strange little world you seem to be on, an asteroid belt and two Territories.

[ [url=Alabaster.html?p=1041][color=#aeb0ab]Extended version of the [LE] Intermission[/color][/url] ]

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed1039.png[/img]

We examine the dreadful planet ALTERNIA III. Somewhere on this planet, there is a young troll.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed1040.png[/img]

This young troll stands in his respiteblock. He lives in a normal hive with a bed, DVDs and four-pane windows. Nothing unusual here!

But the unusual thing is, today this young troll will start playing a game. A dangerous game which will possibly change all of Paradox Space forever!

What will the name of this young troll be?

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed1041.png[/img]

Your name is VICTOR OH HOLY MOTHER OF FUCK. This day happens to be your DEATH DAY. But you don't worry, because having HACKED THE GAME, you know for sure you aren't going to die for real.

A number of EGGS are scattered about your room. You have a variety of INTERESTS. You have a passion for the BIRD WIZARD ANIMATED SERIES. You like the DOOM CROW movies. You read DIBBINS DU LAC every morning before going to bed. You have a fondness for the magnificent documentary [url=https://mspfa.com/?s=508&p=1]TROLL SEASON[/url], and are an aspiring MASTER OF THE WORLD. You also like to play GAMES sometimes.

What will you do?

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed1042.png[/img]

Later!

She's on her way.

p.c: [LE] Victor: Exposit about your fabulous life and your awesome lusus and all that.
p.b:
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed1043.png[/img]

Life is cool when it's full of COCKS and CHICKS! Both help you to produce TROLL OFFSPRING massively, which is part of your plan to CONQUER THE WORLD.

When you are not busy with such important matter, you are HUNTING for the sheer pleasure of it, either hitting your preys at MACH 7 or burning them with your BREATH OF FIRE.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed1044.png[/img]

Your lusus VANEMUINE seems quite impatient to be ridden again.

p.c: [LE] Victor: Exposit on needless caste system.
p.b:
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed1045.png[/img]

Let me tell you about the TRIPLE CASTE SYSTEM.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed1046.png[/img]

... Finally, what about [i]not[/i] doing it? All you have to know is the Alternian hierarchy is very specifically structured following three aspects: blood color, psionic powers and evolutionary ranking. Each of them interact with the two other qualities following very complicated rules. There are entire schools dedicated to understand the TRIPLE CASTE SYSTEM.

An AVIAN-HEADED PURPLE BLOOD HIGH LEVEL PSIONIC doesn't have to worry too much about the System anyway.
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed1047.png[/img]

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed1048.png[/img]

And... KRAK. Well, it was bound to happen.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed1049.png[/img]

You never know when you could get hungry.

You take the fetus using your DISRUPTION MODUS, a practical inventory management interface following the rules of the Triple Caste System, and therefore giving you an unfair advantage all of the time.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed1050.png[/img]

You really need it.

You must resist... But Professor Étanque dragged you here (only English knows how), and now he's drinking and drinking and drinking.

And you remember perfectly how delicious the glitched alcohol they import from Outside-the-Map tastes. How it crackles on any kind of greensunned tongue.

Fuck Étanque.
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed1051.png[/img]

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed1052.png[/img]

First Guardians (or approximately close creatures) can indeed practice sexual intercourse, but the sight of such non-euclidian sex between god-like creatures is so frightening we will have to rely on a symbolic picture to convey the essence of the act.

Or maybe it is a very precise representation of the real thing.

p.c: [LE] Victor: Contact your friend about some game you mentioned offscreen.
p.b:
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed1053.png[/img]

PSYCHE!

You awaken to a joyful music. It's [url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zOETlkc_nNY]an advertising for the TV channel 413ÈME RUE [/url], which is in no way any kind of brainwashing tool mysteriously linked to the ominous villain know as LE SEIGNEUR FRANÇAIS. 
The slogan of the clip, equally funny and in no way meaningful, is "[i]If we had to scratch something, this is how we'd do it[/i]".

Looks like someone is already contacting you. But you cannot answer without a proper NAME! You should probably choose a new TROLLTAG, too.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed1054.png[/img]

Your name is DRACULETTE MALAISE.

Like all your friends, you are an AMAZING WARRIOR gifted with several POWERFUL PSIONIC ABILITIES.

You inhabit an INSANE LABYRINTH you decorated with paintings and posters reflecting your INTERESTS. But you're still NOT AT EASE with it. You like the ALTERVANIA and INHERITANCE OF THE PSIIONIIC video game series, the TV series BEING TROLL and TROLL BLOOD, and all kinds of SUPERNATURAL AND ESOTERIC STORIES. But your main passion is a magnificent experimental deconstruction novel about an alien world, called [url=https://mspfa.com/?s=1276&p=1]HORTMUSTCK[/url].

Your trolltag is [color=#868A08][b]doublespeakingDaywalker[/b][/color] and [color=#868A08]you [the] write [way] in [you] a [type] manner [is] giving [the] headaches [stuff] to [of] everyone [nightmares]![/color]

p.c: [LE] Draculette: Spastically check maspainadvent.trl, you must know if HORTMUSTCK has updated! Then, and only then will you respond to your matesprit.
p.b:
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed1055.png[/img]

The sad thing about HSITDRCUIK is it started really coherent and inventive, managed to stay like this for thousand of pages, and now revolves entirely around a random intermission with a lot of new characters in no way interesting to you.

Who are these guys anyway? Seriously? What are they doing? Why did they exchange places with their planets or something?

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed1056.png[/img]

You really hope this idiotic crap gets back to the serious story about undead mechanical alien frogs it once was.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed1057.png[/img]

And goddammit, even the grammar is turning bad these days. Everyone knows "dinosaurs" is spelled with a y.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed1058.png[/img]

Well, maybe fan adventures are less disappointing these days.

ALERHBTSTER: THE DOORMATE SEASON



[img]./assets/img/story/doomed1059.png[/img]

Your name is PUPPY WHAT THE HELL IS HAPPENING AGAIN. This day happens to be your DEATH DAY. But you don't worry, because having HACKED THE GAME, you know for sure you aren't going to die for real.

A number of CUBES are scattered about your room. You have a variety of INTERESTS. You have a passion for the ANIMATED WIZARDS. You like the CROW DOOM 3D movies. You read DIBBINS DU LAC every morning before going to bed. You have a fondness for the magnificent documentary TROLL SEASON, and are an aspiring MASTER OF THE WORLD. You also like to play GAMES sometimes.

What will you do?
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed1060.png[/img]
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed1061.png[/img]

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed1070.png[/img]

Your name is MATT ENTROICOUPS SMITHINGTON OF THE THIRD BELLANTIC AIR CORP. 

Like previously established, you are impassionate by GENETIC EXPERIMENTS. You also have a very personal theory about the TRIPLE CASTE SYSTEM, inspired by your lusus. Finally, you are kind of a CONSPIRACY THEORIST. 

Your hive is full of BREAD. Even the outside walls are COVERED IN BREAD. You regularly lure trolls to your hive before MURDERING them to steal their SALT and FLOUR. Then you make BEAUTIFUL BREAD with it. You're kind of an ARTISAN.

Your trolltag is [color=#a10000]jeneparlepasFrançais[/color] and [color=#a10000]you réellement love to spice your sentences with quelques words étrangers![/color]

p.c: [LE] Matt: Now let's see some of those experiments.
p.b:
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed1071.png[/img]

Nothing unusual here. You love to play with other trolls' DNA. Particularly the genome of your friends.

You take a minute to behold one of your beautiful Victor-axolotl hybrids. Those are coming out particularly elegant. You don't know why, but Victor's DNA seems to have a particular repulsion for tentacles (allowing you to avoid some of the worst biological disasters) and also a very interesting tendency to SPLIT IN TWO.

Some idiot just got your beautiful CORPSE PILE mixed with disgusting LIVING LIBERTINES.

No, we're not going to do this. 

The author does not want to write it, the narration does not want to contain it, the reader does not want to read it.

We're going to need all our guts for an upcoming conversation that will be known to future generations as the Vast Log.

So the last thing we want now is one hundred lines of [stupid] unreadable [conversation] quirks.

Besides, the conversation mainly goes like this...

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed1095.png[/img]

You fail once again.

A young troll stands in his respiteblock. He lives in a normal hive with a bed, DVDs and four-pane windows. Nothing unusual here!

Except he's some kind of FREAK, having a monstrous lusus-like body. And that he just tried to warn his friends about a TERRIBLE SECRET, only to behold their TRAUMATIZING DEATH.

What will the name of this young troll be?

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed1096.png[/img]

Your name is EUGENE "THE BEAK" BURTON BONBONS LIZZLEBUG RHOMBUS THE 2ND. This day happens to be your DEATH DAY. And you are starting to think SEIGNEUR FRANÇAIS will get you for sure.

A number of EGGS are scattered about your room. You have only one INTEREST, which is a real passion for a benevolent god some HOLY SCRIPTURES talk about. These days, with the meteors falling everywhere, you are really wondering if you should start worshipping this entity, known as THE LORD OF SERPENTS AND REEDS.

Your trolltag is [color=#03B2CD]goldenPyramid[/color] and [color=#03B2CD].you. .really. .like. .to. .nail. .down. .your. .every. .word![/color]

Your resurrection is an overwhelming success, though.
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed1121.png[/img]

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed1124.gif[/img]

Well, it's awfully quiet.

Where are all your Concomitants?

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed1125.png[/img]

Everything is too quiet. 

You do not like this. It reminds you of your first flyover of your Territory. You were amazed, but felt something was off.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed1126.png[/img]

Something is definitely off. 

You cannot find anything. Not even a single corpse. The wooden continent seems completely deserted.

Suddenly, another feeling adds to your anxiety. 

You feel like something is watching you.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed1127.png[/img]

Something viscous. Something powerful. Something sneaky. But deep down, something animal.

A blind spirit in a miry body.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed1128.png[/img]

But no matter where you look... you cannot find it.

It's like if this thing already knew your every move.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed1129.png[/img]

You'd better hurry up. Bat will reach your Egoneir soon.

p.c: [S] Ginneo: Reach and reactivate the 88 Master Battleships.
p.b: [img]./assets/img/story/doomed1130.png[/img] [ [i]Theme: Scharvona - Say no snow[/i] ] This quest is all about extreme furtivity or total beat'em all. The Resident's battalions furiously roam the Crystalline Oceans and any intruder will be clearly seen now that the Lighthouse is lit up.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed1131.png[/img]

In addition, each ship is full of Subaltern Conscripts.
To infiltrate or to clean up all enemies on your way could take days.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed1132.png[/img]

Luckily, you took the time to inspect the sled.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed1133.png[/img]

It contained a hidden costume with the bonus ability of furtivity amongst the Lieutenants!

As long as you don't attack them, the Toy Soldiers will consider you part of their army.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed1134.png[/img]

They could use some glasses.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed1135.png[/img]

Easy enough. You are both Lunatic Primacies of the Coruscant Sovereignty, which means his tower is very close to yours.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed1136.png[/img]

Yessss!

You manipulate one soldier to enter the nearest ship.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed1137.png[/img]

Their health vial is gigantic. They are Lieutenants of the Resident, after all. 

So you let them hurt themselves until their health is almost completely depleted.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed1138.png[/img]

Then you violently stun them on the head!

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed1139.png[/img]

You farm hundred of soldiers like this, until you reach the end of your Stratospectral Escalevelator.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed1140.png[/img]

About time. It is starting to get quite crowded in there.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed1141.png[/img]

With such strength, you grind your way to the entrails of the 88 Ships in no time. You just have to stay furtive when you are on the ice, and to use your weapon when you are inside the vessels.

The game is broken.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed1142.png[/img]

During your reactivation of the ships, you notice a giant chain apparently going through all of the engine rooms. Moving. Providing the engine with energy. 

Wow. This is surely one of the most nonsensical things you've ever seen.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed1143.png[/img]

You finally manage to solve all of the simple puzzles. You gain four Pieces of Speculum Alchemiae by doing so.

Not that you need them anymore. These things were supposed to open the Resident's vessel, and if your Concomitants are to be trusted, not only is the Rubik's Mirror already unlocked, but the creature is out there somewhere.

But you may use the pieces to alchemize yourself some fine stuff!

[i]I am silver and exact. I have no preconceptions.
Whatever I see I swallow immediately
Just as it is, unmisted by love or dislike.
I am not cruel, only truthful-
The eye of the little god, four cornered.
Most of the time I meditate on the opposite wall. 
It is pink, with speckles. I have looked at it so long
I think it is a part of my heart. But it flickers.
Faces and darkness separate us over and over.
Now I am a lake. A woman bends over me,
Searching my reaches for what she really is.
Then she turns to those liars, the candles or the moon.
I see her back, and reflect it faithfully.
She rewards me with tears and an agitation of hands.
I am important to her. She comes and goes.
Each morning it is her face that replaces the darkness.
In me she has drowned a young girl, and in me an old woman
Rises toward her day after day, like a terrible fish.[/i]

You are now Ophiuchus Forever.

You can't be Ophiuchus & Robin because you left Robin back at your hive!

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed1361.png[/img]

Usually bloodswaps are a very interesting idea, changing the mood of your guests for a long time.

It's especially fascinating to see how the Main Twelve can behave with switched caste colors. What would happen if Karkat had neon green blood instead of blue? If Tavros was born as nobility?

Man, you are always so excited to look at the results!

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed1362.png[/img]

However, this time, the transfusion was a huge failure. If only because it became an opportunity for almost all of the Twelvies, X-Trolls and Leen Titans to escape.

The only guest you observed a real behavior change in was Robin.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed1363.png[/img]

The bloodswap modified his attitude from "rebellious" to "dead".

p.c: Ophiuchus the Great: Become the night.
p.b:
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed1364.png[/img]

The cops hunt you. They condemn you. Set the dogs on you.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed1365.png[/img]

Because that's what needs to happen.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed1366.png[/img]

Because sometimes the truth isn't good enough. Sometimes people deserve more.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed1367.png[/img]

A hero. Not the hero trollkind deserved but the hero trollkind needed.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed1368.png[/img]

Nothing less than a knight. Shining.

p.c: Obviously you plan to defeat your archnemesis The Jok... Gamzee!
p.b:
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed1369.png[/img]

Yes. That's why you're here, by the sea.

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed1370.png[/img]

This end-of-world setup is an ideal decor for the Dark Knight to set justice once and for all!

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed1371.png[/img]

You have only you, your advanced Serpentarius Industries technology and [i]one[/i] ally you took with you. Your butler, Alfred. This one will never fail you. 

How do you plan to defeat Gamzee?

[img]./assets/img/story/doomed1372.png[/img]

You already did that!

Nearly a sweep ago, you began replacing Gamzee's sopor slime supply with highly addictive hallucinogenics that cause total psychotic breakdowns if discontinued suddenly. He responded by... eating it. You're pretty sure his liver will have given out completely by now.

p.c: Ophiuchus the Great: Examine large holes in walls.
p.b:
[img]./assets/img/story/doomed1373.png[/img]

Strange. This is a new feature of the hive.

Maybe it's part of the prophecy. These days, strange holes and load gapers seem to appear everywhere on the Main Twelve's hives.

Through three broken walls, you can see the abominable clown himself, working on yet another diabolical invention. This big machine is without a doubt one of the devices allowing him to create his Smilex toxin.
